site_name: BEARIZONA WILDLIFE PARK, L L C

citations.narrative:
The facility self-reported an incident that occurred on 14 February 2025, where 2 adult male Arctic fox were discovered
missing from their outdoor enclosure in the morning. Soon after, the facility found an approximately 4-inch gap, due to
animal activity, at the base of the northeast wall of the enclosure where it meets the earth and subsequently repaired it.
The enclosure walls are built of chain-link fence and wooden slats on three sides and a gunite moat and wall on the guest
viewing side. The facility reports the enclosure has a few inches of buried chain-link fence around the perimeter that
animals have access, except at the spot where the gap was found. Despite search efforts, the animals have not been
sighted or recovered. Failure to maintain facilities in good repair that contain the animals and are structurally sound for the
species contained, may result in severe harm to the animals or aid in their disappearance. The indoor and outdoor
housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and
to contain the animals.
Correct from this date forward of 02 July 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
